children.name: near
children.definition: /nɪəʳ/  only a short distance from a person, place, or thing:
examples: gần
▪ we camped in a forest near a large lake.
▪ don’t go near the fire.
▪ have you ever been to versailles? it’s near paris.
▪ the place where we were going was much nearer than i thought.
near enough to do something
đủ gần để làm cái gì đó
▪ bob was standing near enough to hear what they were saying.
nearer to something/nearest to something
gần hơn với cái gì đó/gần nhất với cái gì đó
▪ if we moved to dallas we’d be nearer to my parents.
▪ only the people who were nearest to the speaker could actually hear what he said.
near here
gần đây
▪ the accident happened somewhere near here.

children.name: close
children.definition: /kləʊs/  very near to something or someone, oralmost touchingthem:gần, sát
examples: ▪ as we approached abbeville, the gunfire sounded very close.
close to
gần, sát với
▪ don’t drive so close to the edge of the road.
close behind/beside
gần, sát đằng sau, bên cạnh
▪ suddenly we heard footsteps close behind us.
close together
gần nhau
▪ the houses were built very close together, and the gardens were rather small.
▪ nancy came over and sat close beside me on the bed.
close bynear where you are :gần đây
▪ is there a gas station close by?

children.name: not far
children.definition: /nɒt ˈfɑːʳ/  not a very long distance away - use this about somewhere that isnearenoughto be easy to get to:không xa
examples: ▪ ‘how far’s the station?’ ‘oh, not far - about ten minutes by car.’
not far from
không xa từ
▪ asti is not far from the french border.
not far away
không quá xa
▪ our hotel was in the centre of town but the beach wasn’t far away.

children.name: nearby
children.definition: /ˌnɪəʳˈbaɪ◂/  near the place where you are or the place you are talking about:
examples: gần đây, gần đó
▪ dave, who was sitting nearby, laughed when he heard this.
▪ the house is really nice, and a lot of my friends live nearby.
▪ it was very convenient having the garage nearby.
nearby[adjective only before noun]gầ, không xa
▪ lucy was staying with her aunt in the nearby town of hamilton.

children.name: neighbouring
children.definition: british /neighboringamerican /ˈneɪbərɪŋ/  a neighbouringcountry,town,areaetc is near the place where you are or the place you are talking about:
examples: láng giềng
▪ the fair attracted thousands of people from neighbouring areas.
▪ soldiers and firemen from 13 neighboring towns wrestled with the blaze for hours.

children.name: a short distance
children.definition: /ə ˌʃɔːʳt ˈdɪstəns/  used to say that something is quite near something or someone:một quãng ngắn
examples: a short distance away
cáchmột quãng ngắn
▪ i’d parked my car a short distance away, just around the corner
.a short distance from
một quãng ngắn từ
▪ harvard university is only a short distance from the center of boston.
a short distance to the south/north etc
một quãng ngắn về phía nam/bắc...
▪ the source of the river is a short distance to the south of here.

children.name: in the vicinity
children.definition: /ɪn ðə vɪˈsɪnti/  formal in the area around and near a particular place:trong vùng lân cận
examples: ▪ a white van was seen in the vicinity at about the time when the murder took place.
in the vicinity of
trong vùng lân cận của
▪ in the past ten years there have been more cases of cancer in the vicinity of nuclear installations.

children.name: nearest
children.definition: /ˈnɪərɪst, ˈnɪərəst/  the nearestshop,stationetcthat is closest to where you are:gần nhất
examples: ▪ excuse me, where’s the nearest subway station?

children.name: the next
children.definition: /ðə ˈnekst/  the next house, street etc that is closest to the one you are in or the one you are talking about:kế bên
examples: ▪ the people in the next apartment were making a lot of noise.
▪ i had to move the car. it’s just around the corner in the next street.

children.name: handy
children.definition: /ˈhændi/  if something is handy, it is near enough for you to pick up and use quickly and easily:
examples: trong tầm tay
keep/have something handy
giữ cái gì đó trong tầm tay
▪ make sure you keep your passport and ticket handy.
▪ a lot of people in the states have a gun handy at night and when they travel.

children.name: within reach
children.definition: /wɪðɪn ˈriːtʃ/  if something is within reach, it is near enough for you to take hold of or touch when you stretch out your hand:
examples: trong tầm với, với tới được
▪ as soon as she was within reach he grabbed her wrist.
within easy reach
gần trong tầm với, với tới được
▪ roy pulled the ashtray towards him so that it was within easy reach.
within somebody’s reach
trong tầm với của ai đó
▪ at this exploratory stage, small children will want to touch anything you leave within their reach.

children.name: within range
children.definition: /wɪðɪn ˈreɪndʒ/  if something is within range, it is near enough for you to attack it or for a weapon to reach it:trong phạm vi
examples: ▪ once its prey is within range, the snake’s head shoots forward to attack.
within range of
trong phạm vi của
▪ the village is well within range of the rockets which are being fired.
come within range of something
vào trong phạm vi của cái gì đó
▪ a day later, the ‘tiger’ convoy came within range of air attack.

children.name: point-blank
children.definition: /ˌpɔɪnt ˈblæŋk◂/  a gun fired point-blank is fired very close to the person or thing it is aimed at:thẳng vào
examples: ▪ the men broke into the building at the dead of night, and shot their victims point-blank as they slept.
point-blank[adjective]thẳng, rất gần
at point-blank range
ở cự ly rất gần
▪ police say that she died as a result of a single bullet fired at point-blank range.

children.name: to get nearer to sb or st
get near/close
children.definition: /ˌget ˈnɪəʳ, ˈkləʊs/  to go or come nearer to a person, place, or thing:tiến tới gần, lại gần
examples: ▪ as kay got near the house she began to feel nervous.
get near/close to
tiến tới gần, lại gần với
▪ we had been traveling for two hours and i knew that we must be getting close to vancouver.
get near/close enough to do something
tiến tới đủ gần, lại đủ gần để làm cái gì đó
▪ i couldn’t get close enough to see what was happening.
get nearer/closer (to something)
tiến tới gần hơn, lại gần hơn (với cái gì đó)
▪ people were running for shelter. the hurricane was getting closer and closer.
▪ every day the russian tanks were getting nearer to berlin.

children.name: approach
children.definition: /əˈprəʊtʃ/  to move gradually closer to a person, place, or thing. approach is moreformalthan get near and get close.:
examples: đến gần
▪ the train slowed down as it started to approach the station.
▪ we could hear footsteps approaching down the corridor.
approaching[adjective]đang đến gần
▪ the speed of the approaching car was close to 80 mph.

children.name: close in on
children.definition: /ˌkləʊz ˈɪn ɒn/  if a group of people close in on someone or something, they gradually move closer to them from all sides so that they surround them in a threatening way:tiến lại gần
examples: ▪ well-organized bands of rebels began to close in on the capital.
▪ the divers were surrounded by three sharks which were rapidly closing in on them.
▪ tv crews closed in on geldof as soon as he stepped out of his car.

children.name: near
children.definition: /nɪəʳ/  to gradually get nearer to a place - used especially in stories or descriptions of events:tới gần, đến gần
examples: ▪ as she neared her home she could see a light in the window.

children.name: draw near /
children.definition: draw near/ˌdrɔː ˈnɪəʳ/  written to move closer to something or someone:lại gần
examples: ▪ the two men were talking, but as we drew near they turned and stared at us.
▪ madge drew a little nearer so that she could hear what he was saying.
draw near to
lại gần với
▪ the rebels hoped that many of the government troops would join them when they drew near to the city.

children.name: within walking distance
children.definition: within walking/driving etc distance/wɪðɪn ˈwɔːkɪŋ ˌdɪstəns/  if a place is , it is not far away, and you can walk there easily:
examples: cách một quãng đường đi bộ , lái xe thôi
▪ there are several good restaurants within walking distance.
within walking/driving etc distance of
cách một quãng đường đi bộ , lái xe để tới (nơi nào đó)
▪ dr goldthorpe lived within walking distance of the university.
within easy walking etc distance (of something)
cách một quãng đường ngắn đi bộ , lái xe để tới (nơi nào đó)
▪ fortunately the house that we were renting was within easy driving distance of the shops.

children.name: within reach
children.definition: /wɪðɪn ˈriːtʃ/  near enough to a town or place for you to get there without too much difficulty:gần
examples: within reach of
gần với
▪ it was just lucky that we were within reach of a hospital.
within easy reach
rất gần
near enough to get to easily
▪ around salzburg there are literally dozens of exciting places to visit -- all within easy reach.

children.name: convenient/handy for something
children.definition: british also convenient to something american /kənˈviːniənt, ˈhændi fəʳ something, kənˈviːniənt tə something/  if your home, office etc is convenient for or handy for a particular place, that place is near it and easy to reach:gần với cái gì đó
examples: ▪ the place where we live now is very convenient for the school - it’s only a couple of minutes on foot.
▪ my husband works in london so we’re looking for a house that’s handy for the station.
▪ we found an apartment convenient to campus and public transportation.
conveniently[adverb]
thuận tiện
▪ the campsite was conveniently situated, close to the beach.

children.name: around the corner
children.definition: also round the corner british /əˌraʊnd ðə ˈkɔːʳnəʳ, ˌraʊnd ðə ˈkɔːʳnəʳ/  not far away, especially in the streets of a town:quanh đây, đâu đó
examples: ▪ ‘is there a bank near here?’ ‘sure, it’s just around the corner.’
▪ she won’t be long, she’s only gone round the corner.
around the corner from
quanh đây, đâu đó gần với (nơi nào đó)
▪ we met in a bar just around the corner from my apartment.

children.name: be close at hand
children.definition: /biː ˌkləʊs ət ˈhænd/  if a building or person is close at hand, they are very near and therefore available in case you need them:gần trong tầm tay
examples: ▪ the exhibition centre is a great day out, with plenty of parking and all the attractions of manchester close at hand.
▪ i’m very glad that, when my children were small, my mother was always close at hand.

children.name: it’s no distance
children.definition: /ɪts ˈnəʊ ˌdɪstəns/ if you say it’s no distance, you mean that a place is not far away and is therefore easy to get to:không xa
examples: ▪ we come up here regularly from london; it’s no distance.
it’s no distance from
không xa từ
▪ it’s no distance from here to fifth avenue. we can easily walk it.

children.name: be a stone’s throw from
children.definition: /bɪː ə ˈstəʊnz θrəʊ frɒm/  if one place is a stone’s throw from another place, it is only a very short distance from it, so that it is easy to get to:rất gần với
examples: ▪ i was born in wembley, a stone’s throw from the football stadium!
only a stone’s throw from something
rất gần với cái gì đó
▪ stanford hospital is only a stone’s throw from where i live.
within a stone’s throw of something
rất gần với cái gì đó
▪ the river’s within a stone’s throw of our apartment - we can see it from the window.

children.name: nearness/closeness
children.definition: /ˈnɪəʳnɪs, ˈnɪəʳnəs, ˈkləʊsns/ trạng thái ở gần
examples: nearness/closeness to
ở gần với
▪ the price of villas varies considerably, according to their facilities and their nearness to the sea.
▪ some of the people took advantage of their village’s closeness to the border and made profits from smuggling.

children.name: proximity
children.definition: /prɒkˈsɪmɪti, prɒkˈsɪmətiǁprɑːk-/  formal nearness:trạng thái gần
examples: proximity to
gần với, vùng lân cận với
▪ san francisco has a significant immigrant population because of its proximity to asia.
proximity of
ở gần với
▪ the proximity of schools, stores, hospitals, and so on is an important factor when purchasing a house.

children.name: near enough to see or hear clearly
close up
children.definition: /ˌkləʊs ˈʌp/  very near, especially so that you can see something clearly:sát
examples: ▪ if you look at the painting close up you can see that it’s a fake.
close up to
sát với
▪ dragging a chair close up to the television screen, she sat down to watch the film.

children.name: at close quarters
children.definition: /ət ˌkləʊs ˈkwɔːʳtəʳz/  if you see or experience something at close quarters, often something dangerous or frightening, you are closer to it than usual, especially so that you can see it clearly:rất gần, ở cự li gần
examples: ▪ from our hiding place we were able to observe the animals at close quarters.
▪ this was the first time i had seen such poverty at close quarters.

children.name: up close
children.definition: /ʌp ˈkləʊs/  very near someone or something, especially after you have only seen them from a distance:lại gần
examples: come/get/go/move etc up close
đi lại gần
▪ brigit looked great from a distance, but when she came up close you could see that she wore a lot of make-up.
▪ ‘all you have to do is to get up close,’ woolley said, ‘ and shoot straight.’

children.name: close-up
children.definition: /ˈkləʊs ʌp/  a photograph taken from very near:bức ảnh cận cảnh
examples: ▪ she brought the camera forward to get a close-up of the actor’s face.
in close-up
cận cảnh
from very near
▪ each butterfly had been photographed in close-up so that you could see every detail.

children.name: to be getting nearer to a person or vehicle in front of you
be catching up
children.definition: /biː ˌkætʃɪŋ ˈʌp/
examples: đuổi kịp
▪ on the last lap of the race, gemma started to catch up, and it looked as though she could still win.
be catching up with
đuổi kịp (ai đó)
▪ looking back i could see that the rest of the group were catching up with us.

children.name: be gaining on/be closing on
children.definition: /biː ˈgeɪnɪŋ ɒn, biː ˈkləʊzɪŋ ɒn/  to be steadily getting nearer to a person or vehicle in front of you that you are chasing or racing against, by going faster than them:bám theo
examples: ▪ donna looked in her rear-view mirror and saw with alarm that the audi was still gaining on her.
▪ now ‘australia ii’ is closing on the american yacht and it could still win this race.

children.name: to stay very near to sb or st
not go near/not come near
children.definition: /nɒt gəʊ ˈnɪəʳ, nɒt kʌm ˈnɪəʳ/ không đến gần
examples: ▪ you’d better not come near me. i’ve got a bad cold.
▪ people didn’t go anywhere near the place at night. they were frightened of ghosts.
▪ don’t go too near the fire!

children.name: stay away from/keep away from
children.definition: /ˌsteɪ əˈweɪ frɒm, ˌkiːp əˈweɪ frɒm/  to never go near something or someone or to not go near them during a period of time, especially in order to avoid danger or trouble:tránh xa khỏi
examples: ▪ stay away from the edge of the cliff.
stay/keep well away from something/somebody
tránh xa khỏi cái gì đó/ai đó
▪ if i were you i’d keep well away from him. he doesn’t have a good reputation.

children.name: keep your distance
children.definition: /ˌkiːp jɔːʳ ˈdɪstəns/  to not go too close to someone or something, especially because it might be dangerous or harmful to go near:giữ khoảng cách
examples: ▪ police warned the public to keep their distance if they saw a man fitting this description.
keep your distance from
giữ khoảng cách với
▪ stick to the paths, and make sure you keep your distance from nesting birds.

children.name: keep back/stay back
children.definition: /ˌkiːp ˈbæk, ˌsteɪ ˈbæk/  if you tell someone to keep back or stay back, you mean that they should not come nearer, especially because of possible danger:lùi lại
examples: ▪ keep back, everyone! the tree may come down at any moment.
keep/stay well back
lùi xa ra
▪ she lit the bonfire and told the children to stay well back.

children.name: to not go near to a person or place
stay close/keep close
children.definition: /ˌsteɪ ˈkləʊs, ˌkiːp ˈkləʊs/ ở gần
examples: stay close/keep close to
ở gần với
▪ while the eggs are hatching the mother bird stays close to the nest.
stay close/keep close together
ở gần nhau
▪ once we’re inside the cave, we must all keep close together. we don’t want anyone to get lost.

children.name: cling to
children.definition: /ˈklɪŋ tuː/  if someone, especially a child, clings to you, they stay close to you all the time, especially because they lack confidence and depend on you too much:bám lấy, dính lấy
examples: ▪ it’s quite common for a child to cling to his or her mother on the first day at school.
▪ one of the girls was clinging to me all night at the disco. i just couldn’t get rid of her.

children.name: hug
children.definition: /hʌg/  to stay very close to the edge or surface of something, especially while moving along it:đi sát
examples: ▪ the new road will stretch from barcelona to the adriatic, hugging the mediterranean coast.
▪ a row of tiny feeding fish were hugging the rock surface where i stood.
▪ after dunseverik, the path hugs the clifftop near brebane head.
